title: NFL Rumors: Patriots to release Russell Bodine after trade from Bills
text:
Russell Bodine lasted all of one week in New England.

The Patriots are releasing the center seven days after acquiring him via trade from the Buffalo Bills, The Boston Globe's Jim McBride reported Friday.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

New England will re-sign center James Ferentz, who was released during roster cuts last Saturday, per McBride.

The Patriots gave up a sixth-round pick to bring in Bodine, a five-year NFL veteran who was Buffalo's starting center last season.

The 27-year-old was expected to compete for David Andrews' vacant spot at center, but it appears Bill Belichick and Co. are more comfortable with Ferentz, who spent the previous two seasons in New England.

Ferentz likely will back up Ted Karras, who seems in line to start at center Sunday night against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

Bodine told us he got a few snaps with Brady in his first practice with the team. Was here about a week. Patriots moving on.



Ferentz now looking like the backup center. Spent a lot of time at guard this summer. Karras got the center reps when Andrews was out. https://t.co/ysFW1soy5l



— Phil Perry (@PhilAPerry) September 6, 2019

NFL Rumors: Patriots to release Russell Bodine after trade from Bills originally appeared on NBC Sports Boston
description: It appears the Patriots didn't like what they saw in Russell Bodine during his lone week in New England.
